meanings.definition: Strive to gain or win something by defeating or establishing superiority over others.
meanings.sent1: The two friends will compete in a race to see who is faster.
meanings.sent2: Many athletes compete in the Olympic Games to win medals.
meanings.sent3: The siblings always compete to see who can finish their chores first.
meanings.sent4: In the business world, companies compete fiercely for market share.
meanings.sent5: Students compete for the top spot in the spelling bee competition.

meanings.definition: To take part in a contest or rivalry.
meanings.sent1: The students will compete in the science fair next week.
meanings.sent2: Teams from different countries compete in the soccer tournament.
meanings.sent3: The dogs compete for attention whenever guests come over.
meanings.sent4: Roses and daisies compete for space in the garden.
meanings.sent5: Children compete in a friendly game of tag during recess.
